key_channel_insights.line_content: OTA pricing remained 92% aligned with the airline's site, but noted a recent increase in higher priced options.
MSE channel offered lower prices 73.53% of the time, enhancing attractiveness for customers in both short and close-in bookings.
GDS maintained 0% price difference compared to the airline's site, highlighting alignment but with an increase in higher pricing cases.

conclusion.line_content: This report provides a high-level summary of the price discrepancies observed across different channels.  It is important to note that the data contains many nuances depending on various factors such as market conditions, booking windows, and the competitive landscape. Understanding these subtleties can be critical in optimizing pricing strategies and ensuring competitive positioning.

As part of our 'PriceEye' solution, we are developing an intuitive dashboard designed to help your airline's analysts drill down into this data. This tool will allow you to uncover and focus on critical actionable insights, enabling your team to make data-driven decisions with confidence.

We are here to support you in leveraging these insights to enhance your revenue management and distribution strategies. Please don't hesitate to connect with our team for more information about how PriceEye can assist you in achieving your business objectives.

ota_highlights.line_content: Approximately 92% of pricing remained the same across OTA and the airline's own site over the last week.
The OTA channel presented prices higher than the airline's site in 5.88% of cases last week, reflecting a small but noteworthy increase.
Only 0.98% of itineraries provided a lower OTA pricing option compared to the airline's pricing in the last week.

ota_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: The 'same' status accounted for 92.16% last week, emphasizing OTA channel alignment with the airline's pricing.
5.88% of the records showed the OTA channel offering higher prices, up from just 1.26% the previous week.

ota_summary_by_region.line_content: Short haul routes showed a 92.16% rate of matching pricing to the airline's website last week.

ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: For origin destinations in AZ, the same pricing was reported at 91.07%, with 5.36% priced higher on the OTA channel.
In Non-AZ routes, the OTA channel's higher pricing rate reached 6.25%, indicating discrepancies warranting attention.

ota_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: For close-in bookings, 89.33% maintained price consistency, while 8% indicated higher prices through the OTA channel.
Far out itineraries exhibited perfect pricing alignment with the airline, consistent across all records.

mse_highlights.line_content: For the latest week, the MSE channel offers lower prices 73.53% of the time compared to the airline's direct website.
Over the last month, the frequency of lower prices in the MSE channel has remained relatively stable, showing an increase of 4.86% compared to last week.
In the close-in booking window, 73.33% of prices on the MSE channel were lower than the airline's site for the latest week.

mse_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: The MSE channel matched the airline's website prices only 4.90% of the time in the latest week.
The MSE channel did not have any higher priced offers when compared to the airline's website across all records.

mse_summary_by_region.line_content: For short-haul flights, MSE prices were lower 73.53% of the time in the latest week, indicating a strong competitive advantage.

mse_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: For Non-AZ origin flights, the MSE channel provided lower pricing 52.08% of the time recently, showcasing efforts to enhance competitiveness in this segment.

mse_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: In the close-in booking window, 73.33% of offers were lower on the MSE channel, emphasizing the channelâ€™s attractiveness for last-minute travelers.
For far-out bookings, the MSE channel maintained lower prices 74.07% of the time in the latest week, demonstrating effective pricing strategies for advance bookings.

gds_highlights.line_content: The GDS channel pricing has shown stability with 0% average price difference compared to the airline's website in the latest week.
For the latest week, the frequency of GDS offering prices that are higher than the website increased slightly by 0.29% compared to the previous week.
Only 0.98% of sampled itineraries in the GDS showed lower fares compared to the airline's website, indicating limited competitive pricing.

gds_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Across all records, there were no offers found in the GDS channel for 2 out of 24 origin-destination pairs, highlighting a lack of competitive pricing.
In the latest week, 49.02% of sampled cases in the GDS reported prices higher than the airline's website, with minimal fluctuations week-to-week.

gds_summary_by_region.line_content: The frequency of the same pricing as the airline's website remained consistent across all regions, with no significant deviations observed.

gds_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Sampling from AZ point of origin indicated a higher frequency of same pricing (92.73%), while the non-AZ point of origin exclusively reported higher prices compared to the website.

gds_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Close-in booking showed a higher GDS frequency of prices compared to the airline's website, with a notable 0.07% increase in higher prices week-over-week.
Far out bookings maintained consistent pricing with only minor variations, emphasizing predictable fare trends in advance purchases.
